items.content_html:
FF115 adds support for Sec-Purpose header in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1836328.

The other browsers are not supported according to https://wpt.fyi/results/preload/prefetch-headers.https.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned in Chrome 116, Safari 172.

Sec-Purpose: prefetch is the new way to indicate a request is a prefetch request. In Firefox it replaces X-moz: prefetch and in Chromium it will replace Purpose: prefetch. I want to avoid tracking that behaviour in BCD if you are OK with it. Instead I have put mention of those in the notes. At some point fairly soon we'll have a situation where all prefetch behaviour is the same.
If you strongly disagree I can add records for those too. Mostly I don't want to try work out when they were first added, since it would have been a very very long time ago, and hard to test.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27171
items.title: FF115 Add Sec-Purpose HTTP header

items.content_html:
This PR removes the version member of the Plugin API from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.3).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/Plugin/version

Additional Notes: The collector states this property is no longer supported.
items.title: Remove api.Plugin.version from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR removes the draining member of the WebTransport API from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.3).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/WebTransport/draining

Note: the collector shows that Firefox does not actually support this property.
items.title: Remove api.WebTransport.draining from BCD

items.content_html:
FF115 supports the Array/TypedArray "change array by copy" methods in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1811057.

This adds the relevant version to:

  • Array.toReversed()
  • Array.toSorted(compareFn) -> Array
  • Array.toSpliced(start, deleteCount, ...items) -> Array
  • Array.with(index, value)
  • TypedArrays.toReversed
  • TypedArrays.toSorted
  • TypedArrays.with()

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27175
items.title: FF115 supports change array by copy methods

items.content_html: I found that there was a duplicate entry for the page property in the @page at-rule data. This, however, is unconventional to BCD and shouldn't be placed in the at-rules data.
items.title: Remove duplicate entry for page property in page at-rule

items.content_html:
ApplicationCache was disabled in release in FF84 behind a preference - but I missed the ApplicationCache entry back then in #7481. In FF115 it was fully removed.

My thinking is that this should simply marked as removed in FF84. BUT, given how long ago that was, should we simply purge this whole record? Note that it is not linked on MDN.

Other docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27176

FYI @queengooborg
items.title: FF84 ApplicationCache disabled - FF115 removed

items.content_html:
This PR adds NodeJS v20.2.0 to our browser data. This unblocks #20110.

Additionally, this fixes the URL to the release notes for NodeJS v20.0.0 to point to the proper release notes rather than the blog post.
items.title: Add NodeJS v20.2.0

items.content_html:
This PR fixes #18777 by stripping out the patch versions in the NodeJS releases, leaving only major and minor release numbers. This follows our conventions better.

Note: this will fail CI for the time being as I have only modified the browsers.json as a proof-of-concept. If this PR is approved, I will then make the appropriate changes to the remaining files.
items.title: Remove patch versions from NodeJS releases

items.content_html:
Added the 'mdn-url' key to the font-synthesis-* properties.

Content PR that adds these pages: mdn/content#27413
items.title: Add "mdn_urls" to font-synthesis-* properties

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates and corrects version value for Deno for caches object and CacheStorage interface. The data comes from the Deno Runtime APIs document.

Test results and supporting details

I couldn't make the test on Deno 1.26.0. But I've tested the caches object and methods from CacheStorage interface in Deno 1.34.4 and can confirm it does work.

Supporting details
  • Deno Runtime APIs document

Related issues

None
items.title: Update deno data for Cache API

items.content_html:
This PR removes the overflow-clip-box CSS property from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/overflow-clip-box

Additional Notes: The pages for these properties was removed long ago, but the BCD files were left behind. It appears that these are only available in Gecko Chrome code; in other words, internal only. (See https://web.archive.org/web/20200910193159/https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Gecko/Chrome/CSS/overflow-clip-box.)
items.title: Remove overflow-clip-box CSS property from BCD

items.content_html: This PR removes various scroll-snap-* CSS properties from BCD. These properties can now be considered irrelevant as no modern browsers support any of them, as has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project and manual testing.
items.title: Remove irrelevant scroll-snap-* CSS properties

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the page CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/page
items.title: Update Safari data for page CSS property

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the ReadableStreamDefaultReader member of the ReadableStreamDefaultReader API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/ReadableStreamDefaultReader/ReadableStreamDefaultReader
items.title: Update Firefox data for api.ReadableStreamDefaultReader.ReadableStreamDefaultReader

items.content_html:
Summary

Added the auto value to the animation-duration, in order to show support for this value that which was proposed as part of [https://drafts.csswg.org/css-animations-2/#propdef-animation-duration](CSS Animations Level 2), this way users can easily see where this value has been support and from when.

Test results and supporting details

Currently only supported in Chrome 115.

Related issues

Associated MDN Content issues: 26685 & 26687
Associated Bugzilla bugs: 1808410 & 1737920

Associated MDN Content PR - 27075
items.title: 26685 26687 view progress timelines

items.content_html:
Summary

I've added browser compatibility data for isUrlFilterCaseSensitive

Test results and supporting details

Version data was taken from this comment

mdn/content#26908 (review)

Chrome version information was taken from this message

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-extensions/c/TXYUmvDHUlw/m/9JdxXG2cAgAJ

Related issues

This PR is related to this PR mdn/content#26908
items.title: Add BCD for isUrlFilterCaseSensitive field

items.content_html:
FF115 adds support for new value option to URLSearchParams.has() and delete() methods. This adds the value.

Lots of tracking info in whatwg/url#735 and testing shows:

  • this is not yet in chrome.
  • Safari says it went into https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safari-technology-preview-release-notes/stp-release-171 which I have marked as preview - is that correct?
  • Node added it in 20.2.0 but latest version is 20.0.0 in BCD. Don't know how I work out engines etc to add that entry - is 20.0.0 close enough?
  • Deno has PR but not yet merged.

Tests on WPT are:

  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-delete.any.html
  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-has.any.html

Upshot, need to confirm that safari and node values are OK to progress this.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27172
items.title: URLSearchParams has() and delete() have new value option

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the documentation needs of Bug 1606862 Make devtools an optional permission.

No reference found to this permission in the Chrome documentation e.g. https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/declare_permissions/#permissions or https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/devtools_inspectedWindow/

Confirmed as included in Safari on this page: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safariservices/safari_web_extensions/adding_a_web_development_tool_to_safari_web_inspector#3966899
items.title: devtools as optional permission

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the SpeechSynthesisVoice API. This bug was discovered when writing tests for the mdn-bcd-collector. This adds a note mentioning this bug and recommending a solution based on GooborgStudios/mdn-bcd-collector@365ad25.
items.title: Update Firefox data for SpeechSynthesisVoice API
